entries.meaning: Of a system, currently not connected (generally electrically) to a larger network. For example, a power plant which is not connected to the grid, or a computer which is not connected to the Internet or to any other communications service.
examples: I saved the web pages so I could read them later offline.

entries.meaning: (by extension) Happening in the physical world (the real world) as opposed to on the internet.
While offline; with an offline system.
(business slang) Outside the current meeting, in a more private setting.

verbs.description: offline (third-person singular simple present offlines, present participle offlining, simple past and past participle offlined)

entries.meaning: (computing, transitive) To take (a system, etc.) offline; to demote from an active or online state.
examples: Offlining a memory processor can be accomplished by using the flexible interleaving capability described earlier to interleave segments across subsets of the memory processors, avoiding the faulty one(s).
